column1: Wyoming is blessed to have such strong representation in the U.S. House. @RepLizCheney has quickly risen to third in House leadership. I can see a future where she could be Speaker & @SenJohnBarrasso Majority Leader.

Today the Senate passed historic bipartisan trade legislation – USMCA – that will provide certainty to Wyo industries & ensure we can maintain beneficial trade relationships with Mexico and Canada. Now it heads to @realdonaldtrump’s desk for his signature. https://t.co/6rdtD2cBvm https://t.co/HfPeVhFydB

It’s long past time to rein in the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. I cosponsored 2 bills that would either increase accountability or eliminate the bureau. It’s important that every agency is consistent and does not have less oversight than another. https://t.co/PvVUNE21ve

I’ve decorated my office in D.C. to remind me of Wyoming – it helps to get me through the week until I get back to Wyoming again. Come along for a video tour of my office where I talk about some of the unique memorabilia I’ve collected over the years. https://t.co/vz2SgWq2SQ

A year of hard work paid off in Washington and I’m excited for the year ahead. I wrote about my year and what’s going on for Wyoming. Last year will be remembered by the people I met businesses I visited and projects that turned into passions. https://t.co/jX6KeN3NWI

In 2018 Wyoming produced about $270 million exports to Canada and Mexico. For many industries like agriculture machinery and minerals this deal would help create and maintain quality jobs in the state while fostering new innovation and fairer trade across the board.

I was proud to join my colleagues on the Senate Finance Committee today to vote in support of the United States Mexico and Canada Agreement bringing the deal one step closer to final approval. https://t.co/DLR3iebxYT

Merry Christmas to everyone in Wyoming and around the country who are celebrating! Diana and I hope today is filled with loved ones giving back good food plenty of cookies and so much more. May the joy of this season stay with you and your family throughout the coming year. https://t.co/HKzYtIaxzA

I’m pleased Congress passed legislation to help combat unwanted and potentially dangerous phone calls. I look forward to it becoming law soon so families can have some relief from robocalls. https://t.co/Z6tu9XuSV7

Currently for-profit colleges are not allowed to receive more than 90% of their revenue from federally funded student aid. We should make sure that all institutions of higher education are fairly held to this requirement and providing quality education. https://t.co/Vj8ZS5Cci0

I'm pleased to cosponsor the Lower Costs More Cures Act to help bring relief from high drug costs. There are many proposals focused on lowering prescription drugs costs but our legislation focuses on solutions with the strongest bipartisan support. https://t.co/URA1crS6Ft

It was put together with little actual member input & violates nearly all the Senate budget rules. We should be talking about how to address the mess we are in not pressing the gas on unsustainable fiscal trajectory which is exactly what this bill does. https://t.co/VmGtVmvwhj

I’m disappointed the Senate passed a spending deal today that will add to the already massive debt burden being placed on future generations. It provides Christmas presents for everyone – all put on the federal credit card which is overspent already. https://t.co/DJ8enmKeJd

I introduced a bill with @SenJohnBarrasso and @SenatorRomney to help ensure accuracy with community college graduation rate reporting by more appropriately reflecting the diversity of more part-time non-first-time students. https://t.co/kcZ1q5R8TC
It’s important for students and families to have the most accurate information before choosing a college that best fits their needs.
This NDAA has a much different budgetary impact than the bill the Senate reported earlier this year. Congress has the power to change course and I hope we do in the future.

For example it includes a non-defense provision that will provide all federal employees with 12 weeks of paid parental leave. This is a new benefit that costs more than $8 billion and it passed without debate by inclusion in this defense bill.

Our nation is on an unsustainable fiscal course. We simply cannot continue down this path. While the NDAA is well-intentioned with many proposals I support it ignores our overspending problem & furthers the practice of passing legislation while ignoring the rules of the Senate. https://t.co/jokYrqOo02

The GREAT Act would help simplify the grant reporting process and keep better track of taxpayer dollars. I’m pleased the House passed this important legislation and look forward to the president signing it into law soon. https://t.co/VUGl8atIrn

Diana and I were grateful to help lay wreaths on graves of the 3000 veterans in Casper’s Oregon Trail Veterans Cemetery on Saturday. One of the names we saw was @RepLizCheney’s grandfather. Our fallen service members will always be our heroes. May we never forget to honor them. https://t.co/ifIngIJv9v

I introduced legislation today with @SenatorJonTester that would cement into law how government agencies regulate food produced using animal cell-culture technology so folks know what they are eating and that it is safe. https://t.co/b9FByYeoTm
Emerging cell-culture technologies may reshape the food industry in the coming years. Existing food safety laws were drafted long before these technologies were contemplated.

Every year I have the honor of nominating outstanding Wyoming students to our service academies. The academies not only offer a quality education but provide a unique set of skills that graduates will carry with them throughout their lives. Learn more: https://t.co/ZMFUes3Nuu https://t.co/V9cdmW6k38
It was great to catch up with the @WY_StockGrowers today and answer questions about what’s going on in Washington! https://t.co/xZ1vziFzRZ
The unemployment rate is also at a 50-year low! I was proud to sponsor this bill and it’s great to see the success it is bringing to American workers.

Our economy is thriving thanks in part to the #TaxCutsandJobsAct. After almost 2 years it's brought more jobs and kept hard-earned money in workers’ pockets. That’s nearly 7 million more jobs and 2.4% growth in economy for 2019 according to the Treasury Dept. https://t.co/jOmHxUmpPC
If you love Wyoming and trivia follow me on Instagram and test your Wyoming knowledge on my stories! This week it’s about women’s suffrage. https://t.co/th4EWvfY8E

Government shutdowns do not benefit anyone and actually end up costing taxpayers more money. I cosponsored legislation that would prevent future government shutdowns. It is time to end unnecessary shutdowns for good. https://t.co/Mlpp7SoAWB

Wyoming is also home to the first woman governor first woman justice of the peace first all-woman jury and many more accomplishments. My wife Diana joins me in commemorating our state for these monumental milestones.

We are celebrating an incredible landmark today – 150 years ago Wyoming led the way by granting women the right to vote and hold office. The Equality State is proud to have taken this important step 50 years before the enactment of the 19th Amendment. https://t.co/q2ohLvhEk5

150 years ago on Dec. 10 1869 the Wyoming Territory approved the first law in the history of the United States recognizing women’s inherent right to vote and to hold public office. Learn more: https://t.co/oABRHuCjHG

Tomorrow is Wyoming Women's Suffrage Day a testament to the contributions women have made – and continue to make – to Wyoming and the values that make our state stand out as an example for the rest of the country. https://t.co/AvTNcXZp26

Every year my wife Diana and I host a cookie party to say thank you to those who keep the Capitol running – everyone from cafeteria workers and photographers to electricians and Capitol police officers stop by to enjoy some homemade treats. We couldn’t do what we do without them! https://t.co/ijZe41eBgX

I’m saddened that my colleague and friend @SenatorIsakson will be leaving the Senate at the end of the year. It’s been a privilege for me to work with Johnny on a number of legislative efforts. His experience knowledge and friendship will be missed. https://t.co/vT6V7mdvns

Wyoming is proud to be home to many family-owned businesses. This #SmallBusinessSaturday remember to stop by your local shops – as some of the best gifts come from local artists and retailers. What’s your favorite Wyoming small business? https://t.co/pxZONbYJYn
Happy Thanksgiving from my family to yours! Diana and I send our best wishes and hope everyone has a safe and happy holiday. https://t.co/AKHeeVGtg6

Pleased the Senate unanimously passed my resolution with @SenJohnBarrasso to recognize Dec. 10 2019 as Wyoming Women’s Suffrage Day. The 150th anniversary of Wyoming granting women the right to vote is a monumental milestone and I’m excited to celebrate it.
Supporting temporary positions means filling the gaps in our economy – and further supporting jobs that Americans already hold. https://t.co/tyevBRjMDU

While America is experiencing record-low unemployment this puts a strain on seasonal and tourist businesses due to the low number of available temporary workers. By increasing temporary work visas seasonal employers will be able to overcome the burden of being understaffed.

Today marks the 40th anniversary of the Congressional Award! Every year Wyoming is proud to be one of the states with the most gold medal recipients. Encourage an outstanding student you know to learn more about the opportunities of @theaward program: https://t.co/1DXRgEdj32 https://t.co/9sYfItntnQ
I’m glad the director of FDA’s Center for Tobacco Products committed to providing more transparency as required by law and implementing color graphic warning labels. https://t.co/5RDPFrUC7L

The right approach to tobacco policy is to get people to stop smoking or – better yet – to never start. We need to know how the Tobacco Control Act is working and be responsive to new technologies and potential threats to our children and the public health.

This past weekend Diana and I met with several Wyoming cadets at @WestPoint_USMA. It was exciting to see how far these hardworking cadets have come since they were nominated to the academy. Wyoming is proud of you! https://t.co/l60TqUfYHh

I'm proud to introduce a resolution with @SenJohnBarrasso to designate Dec. 10 2019 as Wyoming Women's Suffrage Day to celebrate the 150th anniversary of Wyoming granting women the right to vote. https://t.co/g9zqG8OaB4 https://t.co/Cip91olbxD

Today we take time to thank and appreciate our country’s veterans for their service and sacrifice. Wyoming is proud to be home to thousands of veterans and Diana and I send them our best wishes. https://t.co/q15slixcCc

I’m pleased the government affairs committee passed @RandPaul's Bonuses for Cost-Cutters Act. This bill incentivizes employees to find and eliminate waste in the government’s spending rather than promoting the status quo “use it or lose it” mentality. https://t.co/PI7XMNYksY
This is the first bipartisan budget process reform bill passed out of committee since 1990 - almost 30 years! https://t.co/UUu7Vl4oaB

I'm excited the Budget Committee passed my bipartisan bill with @SenWhitehouse which will make the budget process more orderly deliberative & focused on long-term planning. We need to fix our country’s fiscal problems so future generations are not faced with disaster. https://t.co/iGrRnrUbaF
Shifting the budget resolution to a two-year cycle is an important first step toward fixing America’s #brokenbudget process. https://t.co/ScdsZtvuFC
Americans deserve fiscal transparency when it comes to government spending. We need this bipartisan budget reform bill more than ever. #brokenbudget https://t.co/XMGPgMsaJq
Looking forward to the Budget Committee taking up our bill later today and moving it to the full Senate. https://t.co/Og5vRNAIpB

The current budget process is broken and the American people deserve better. I wrote an opinion article with @senwhitehouse explaining how our historic legislation would take a needed and important step toward restoring the broken budget process. https://t.co/mg6KYzFsZ0 https://t.co/Jb1UUr8sET

I introduced a bill that would help ensure our national parks are properly maintained so folks can continue to enjoy them now and in the future without adding to the national debt. https://t.co/Z4jY9Fb5X6
Our national parks are a testament to our heritage and the natural beauty of this nation. However without sufficient funding our parks can fall into disrepair.

I joined @SenJohnBarrasso and 10 other senators in urging @WorldBank to finance projects that increase access to affordable and reliable electricity on a large enough scale to help poor nations gain economic opportunities and reduce poverty. https://t.co/nSC4DMgFmN
BOO! Need a real scare? Beware of our nation’s out-of-control spending. It’s time to fix our #brokenbudget https://t.co/GJRu8xFZJF

I introduced an amendment to the upcoming Senate appropriations bill that would make housing programs more efficient and effective. Better services may ultimately get more money to the people who need assistance in a more streamlined way. https://t.co/Lo8HXEtj7K

Contrary to some outdated reports I cosponsored @LindseyGrahamSC's resolution. While the House has the right to craft its own rules I don't believe it's following its own precedent or going about the process in a manner that's fair to the president and the House minority party.

Our country’s deficit is growing at a dangerous pace. While revenue is growing spending is growing twice as fast. The @USTreasury reported the deficit surged more than 26% in the last year. We must fix our #brokenbudget. https://t.co/9HDQ5mnHjG

Retirement security is an important issue. I'm glad the Senate passed my resolution to capture the importance and raise awareness of personal financial literacy. By committing to save you are committing to a financially secure future. Read my op-ed: https://t.co/NkqyxcKfUZ https://t.co/uxPC9gx2ZK

This young man lost both of his legs in Afghanistan but he did not let being in a coma for six weeks having 26 injuries and 28 surgeries – including a tracheotomy and a double amputation – stop him. I look forward to reading his book Walking Again. https://t.co/yYLtNba85U

Diana and I were honored to be part of the Marshall Legacy Institute’s Clearing the Path event this week. We heard some powerful and inspirational stories of faith and courage that we can all learn from. One such story is that of retired U.S. Army Specialist @JPLaneOfficial.

Hardworking Americans overwhelmingly agree we can’t afford a private pension bailout. The House-passed multiemployer pension bailout bill would hold the majority of Americans who are NOT on these plans responsible for bailing out the small number who are. This hardly seems fair! https://t.co/3etdP9yFsL

If you are a Wyoming high school junior I encourage you to apply to be a U.S. Senate page! This program gives students a front row seat to see history in the making while gaining real work experience. Applications for the spring are due Nov. 6. More here: https://t.co/bFV7KtatBE https://t.co/yfM4qqqy6Y

Economic harm caused by unnecessarily crippling energy projects is real. Reforming the #CleanWaterAct is key to exporting WY’s natural resources & supporting jobs. I signed a letter @SenatorBarrasso led in support of the @EPA proposal to tackle this issue. https://t.co/6BIHViQlLE

I’m glad the Senate passed the GREAT Act led by @SenatorLankford which reinforces fiscal responsibility by simplifying the grant process to help keep track of hundreds of billions of taxpayer dollars. https://t.co/zrzWMkV11D

It was a great weekend in Laramie celebrating the University of Wyoming Homecoming and a Wyoming football win! I enjoyed talking with UW alumni and seeing the Laramie community at the parade. https://t.co/XD8SW3OPDK
Local art is one of Wyoming’s unique treasures and an important part of our economy. Read how these Wyomingites turned their passions into professions: https://t.co/q5CxP8pDNJ https://t.co/5lbGDuCNJk
We should be supporting innovation in the energy industry rather than implementing overly burdensome rules that could increase energy costs and put people out of work.

I’m glad the Senate showed bipartisan support for the Affordable Clean Energy rule today. The Clean Power Plan was designed to get rid of coal while the Affordable Clean Energy rule restores power to states like Wyoming. https://t.co/xOsFAnfvo7
I’m glad to be teaming up with @GovernorGordon to promote the importance of saving for retirement across Wyoming and our country. https://t.co/Q6d58kLWMK

Wyoming produces more than 90% of the nation’s soda ash – a compound commonly used to make glass paper and detergents – and it is the state’s top international export. Reducing the federal royalty rate will allow America’s soda ash to stay competitive in the global market.
Yesterday the @BLMNational proposed a rule to help lower the federal tax imposed on soda ash mineral production which is great news for our state and American jobs. https://t.co/eivk2hsDL5

Christa McAuliffe was a teacher who died aboard the Space Shuttle Challenger in 1986. She was driven by a mission to inspire young minds and made great strides in the education community. https://t.co/C17oqTPni7

Today @realDonaldTrump signed the Christa McAuliffe Commemorative Coin Act into law. I was glad to cosponsor this bipartisan bill with @SenatorShaheen to help honor McAuliffe’s memory by advancing STEM opportunities for students.
Good news! The unemployment rate for September was 3.5% - the lowest it has been since 1969. https://t.co/lPn66phIr2

I’m pleased @realdonaldtrump signed the Autism CARES Act into law. I introduced this important bill with @SenatorMenendez to help support people with autism spectrum disorder throughout their lifetime. https://t.co/13DIG2bFJi

Calling all University of Wyoming students! If you’re interested in an internship in Washington D.C. come visit one of my staff members at the BIG Job Fair in the Union Ballroom tomorrow Oct. 2. Learn more here: https://t.co/J5uKRHYuGI
Thank you to our keynote speaker Susan Pieper of @DMOSCollective for sharing her wisdom as a Wyoming business owner. https://t.co/UdwqFlMjmx

This weekend I hosted my Inventors Conference in Evanston where I saw firsthand the ingenious ideas coming from our state. From patents to funding options experts representing business resources came to help entrepreneurs make their invention journeys happen. https://t.co/RJcIrR5Ayk

I spent a wonderful Saturday at Hero Appreciation Day in Rock Springs honoring our Wyoming military and first responders. They are not only heroes for their service but also for their commitment to our communities. It was great to see how Sweetwater County shows its appreciation. https://t.co/V4G2F8xN1q

Wyoming recognizes trailblazing folks by honoring them in the Wyoming Cowboy Hall of Fame. This organization works to preserve the important cowboy and ranching history of our state. Congrats to the 2019 inductees & their families – they are now part of cowboy history! https://t.co/kV5Zo1pAJf

I’m glad FDA is taking steps to advance awareness & education of biosimilars – an idea like the one included in my bipartisan bill. This new webpage for patients will help increase understanding of biosimilar products which could drive down drug costs. https://t.co/V1ylbnRQem

Today the Senate unanimously reauthorized the Autism CARES Act to promote research education and awareness into autism spectrum disorder and other developmental disabilities. I introduced this bill with @SenatorMenendez. Now it heads to @POTUS's desk. https://t.co/tnTFeszxat

I’m glad the House introduced companion legislation to my biosimilars education bill with @SenatorHassan. This legislation would help to drive down drug costs by increasing confidence in cheaper prescription drug alternatives like biosimilars. https://t.co/bPmo8VVyNF

Job training centers like the Wind River Job Corps Center make a positive difference in our economy and job market. I asked Eugene Scalia the labor secretary nominee about his ideas to improve job training and Job Corps in states like Wyoming. https://t.co/EEv4GNObhx https://t.co/CCY3ssAbDQ

Congratulations to Jim Jackson of Sheridan on his 2019 @NEAarts National Heritage Fellowship award! Jackson received this lifetime achievement for his impressive leather craftsmanship. Read more about Jim’s art here: https://t.co/xwyEssc8f2 https://t.co/ozpf9EemeH
Happy 72nd birthday to the @usairforce! Wyoming is proud to be the home of F. E. Warren Air Force Base and the 90th Missile Wing. https://t.co/Z1jOwbX7S6

If you have a great idea that you’d like to turn into a reality I invite you to my Inventors Conference in Evanston this Saturday Sept. 21. Regardless of background or experience everyone is welcome to attend this free event. To register: https://t.co/0QcHrix1aI https://t.co/CtN4K3IZTb

There are few documents that have had a greater impact on history than our Constitution which established our government protects our rights & has been an inspiration for other nations for 200+ years. We celebrate #ConstitutionDay & the document that holds our nation together. https://t.co/RbWDQTI9Iy

I'm glad @EPA is repealing the excessively burdensome Waters of the United States rule which was a massive regulatory overreach that should have never been allowed in the first place. States know best how to manage our resources. https://t.co/doqzGDEj5I

I have the honor of nominating a select few Wyoming students who aspire to attend U.S. military service academies. This is an exceptional opportunity for those interested in military careers. I encourage anyone who is interested to apply by Nov. 5! https://t.co/idrz6LpDoD

May we never forget the tragedy our country endured on September 11 2001 and that our freedom is not free. Today we honor the innocent lives lost and the bravery of the first responders. The memory of those Americans who gave their all will live on forever. https://t.co/r0Lx7p2UlK

Right here in Wyoming there are many opportunities like the Wyoming Contractors Association Regional Training Center Climb Wyoming the Wind River Job Corps & community college programs to provide education & skills training to help workers succeed in the 21st century economy.

Every year many Americans achieve their goals with the help of technical programs. This September the Senate is celebrating National Workforce Development Month and appreciating the value these programs bring to our communities. https://t.co/qZgsO3M9da

The Veterans History Project Day in Cheyenne was rewarding. A special thanks to the veterans who participated - their stories will be preserved in the @librarycongress to forever be honored. Many hardworking volunteers are excited to bring this project to more communities in Wyo. https://t.co/7uQtncVFIs

This weekend I visited the @lclsonline and helped show @LibnOfCongress what impressive resources Wyoming libraries have to offer. I remember getting my first library card in Thermopolis when I was a kid. It’s great to see libraries are still a key part of our communities. https://t.co/3rDjWN5R9p

Every year the Louisa Swain Foundation hosts a reenactment of Louisa Swain's first vote. This was a win for not only Wyoming women but for women across the country. My wife Diana introduced the @LibnOfCongress Dr. Carla Hayden who portrayed Louisa Swain in the reenactment. https://t.co/bA0sOQoQAO

I was honored to speak at the 2nd annual USO Patriot Invitational in Hulett on Saturday. Military service requires sacrifices of not only the service member but the families. The USO plays a leading role in showing appreciation & keeping the spirits of our service members high. https://t.co/FN2UqlYyKi
@librarycongress To learn how to get involved: https://t.co/vpijXeG3AG

Every veteran’s story is important & the @LibraryCongress is working to collect as many as possible through the Veterans History Project. I invite veterans to come record their important stories. We also need volunteers to help interview. Join us at LCCC in Cheyenne on Sept. 7! https://t.co/T93cemD3DT

The Supreme Court should rule in cases only as the law dictates without regard to the identity of the parties or politics of the moment. I joined @senatemajldr & other Senate Republicans in condemning recent threats to pack the Supreme Court. https://t.co/s20QZLpuIK

I’m glad @EPA announced its proposal to update the national methane standards for the oil and natural gas industry. We in Wyoming know the benefit that oil and gas development has on our communities & I look forward to reviewing the draft rule in full. https://t.co/PSoWwPR80T

Do you have a great idea for an invention but aren’t sure how to make it a reality? Come to my Inventors Conference in Evanston on Sept. 21. You’ll learn more about patent process business planning funding options & marketing. Hope to see you there! https://t.co/4lzcSnmqsF https://t.co/q0ZzUfSel9
For me the best kept secrets in Wyoming are my fishing spots – but don’t tell anyone where they are. What’s your favorite hidden treasure in the Cowboy State? https://t.co/Zufj5KiPQU

I appreciate the @USDA for acting swiftly to provide Wyoming producers with crop insurance protection for those hurt by the Gering-Ft. Laramie-Goshen tunnel collapse. This decision will help provide certainty to our producers during this critical time. https://t.co/weUirjPLL5

Is there a veteran in your life? My office is teaming up with the Library of Congress to host a Veterans History Project Day on Sept. 7 at LCCC in Cheyenne. We invite veterans and volunteers to come participate. To learn more visit my website: https://t.co/vpijXeG3AG https://t.co/UJRwIMdX63

Thanks to Assistant Energy Secretary Steve Winberg for making the trip out to Wyoming to see the Dry Fork Station power plant and the @WyomingITC outside of Gillette. It was great to help show him the innovative coal research that is going on in our state. https://t.co/k08R0TIC8V

Last month a 2200 foot-long tunnel partially collapsed along the Fort Laramie Canal. I joined Sen. @SenJohnBarrasso @RepLizCheney and Nebraska lawmakers in writing to the sec of ag seeking crop insurance protection for producers hurt by the collapse. https://t.co/DzcIB3b4Zp

David Street Station is a community plaza in downtown Casper. This is a great place for folks to gather for events and activities year-round. It was great to visit with some business owners and see the outdoor splash pad that turns into a skating rink in the winter. https://t.co/U2d6xnyoyF

The Kittel family bought a ranch they wanted to rehabilitate in 2016. They're working hard to build their operation from the ground up to offer black Angus & Scottish Highland beef. I enjoyed touring the Diamond K ranch – and catching up with my former staffer Kim Kittel. https://t.co/tAHJOgmIY8

Last week Diana and I toured the @BrushCreekRanch in Saratoga. This luxury resort is also a working ranch with 30000 acres 350 head of cattle 100 miles of fencing greenhouses & more. It was wonderful to see this impressive property that still maintains a Western way of life. https://t.co/j9Ujh10RHI

Wyoming is proud to be home to many family-owned farms and ranches. Each year the @WYOSHPO honors families who reached 100 years of owning & operating the same farm or ranch. Congrats to the 2019 honorees on this milestone and may we celebrate many more years to come! https://t.co/FAWZ7Zoofz

I’m excited to host a Veterans History Project Day in Cheyenne next month to help collect and preserve our veterans’ memories. This is a wonderful opportunity to show gratitude for our veterans. I encourage everyone to be part of this important project. https://t.co/VDYcJvIRLC
Last week Diana and I had an exciting day celebrating @WYStateFair. It was nice to see so many families out at the parade! https://t.co/954CJ0vreu

In March a federal judge halted drill permitting on Wyo oil & gas leases. I joined @SenJohnBarrasso and @RepLizCheney in asking @Interior what steps it's taking to ensure that future development on federal oil and gas leases are allowed to continue. https://t.co/5vQaSsRlOv

The 19th Amendment was a win for women and our nation as a whole. Today we celebrate the anniversary of the amendment’s ratification. As the Equality State Wyoming is proud to have taken the first step in 1869 toward women’s equality. https://t.co/XSbGoGaglK

Congrats to Jim Wilson and Dick Hiser for being inducted into the Wyoming Agriculture Hall of Fame. It was also great to meet Miss Rodeo Wyoming Hannah Ostheimer and the Agriculture in the Classroom Educator of the Year Ashlee Seidel. https://t.co/kj5jNsk0XR

Last week I toured local businesses in Jackson that are up to exciting things! I met with scientists from @Extherid the owners of Brewhouse Coffee & StillWest along with Farmstead cidery. These folks are a great representation of entrepreneurial spirit and innovation in Wyo. https://t.co/bq5BZulrIM
This decision to grant waivers for refineries that would otherwise see severe economic harm is good for workers in Wyoming and across the country. https://t.co/StBg9fA8p5

I’m glad the EPA recognized that exemptions from the Renewable Fuel Standard are necessary for small refineries to compete. The energy industry is essential to Wyoming’s economy and our nation’s energy independence.

It was an impressive time in Riverton where I attended the grand opening of Wind River Cares Clinic a Job Corps graduation and a Native American Education Conference. Congratulations to these passionate people on their accomplishments. All the hard work does not go unnoticed! https://t.co/ClYbNkNj7j

The @EPA proposal to rein in improper use of the Clean Water Act is important for exporting Wyo’s natural resources & supporting jobs. Clarifying the process should lead to more responsible permitting that protects U.S. water rather than political motives. https://t.co/W1nRM2Weg2

Increasing the amount of US beef sold in the EU market is good for our ranchers economy and country. We produce some of the highest quality beef & I'm glad Wyo farmers and ranchers will have more certainty. Our livestock industry is vital to our economy. https://t.co/MoFXQEEC1u

This September we celebrate initiatives and programs that help students obtain valued skills. With the Career and Technical Education Act in action there is no better time to applaud the hardworking workforce that is at the foundation of our economy.

Growing a strong economy starts with preparing the next generation with proper technical education. I’m pleased the Senate again recognized the need for reliable workforce development to continue supporting our hardworking Americans. https://t.co/Oef5bJYv3Q

It is great news that a Wyoming native will be the acting head of the Bureau of Land Management. I have known William Pendley for many years and I am confident he understands the unique public land challenges that western states face. https://t.co/YpA8HEIzem
Our withdrawal sends a clear message that we will not stand idly by while Russia works to openly violate treaties and international norms.
I applaud the Administration’s actions to withdraw from the INF Treaty and am committed to working with our NATO allies to appropriately respond to Russia’s behavior. https://t.co/DZlQBQTDTN

I’m troubled by continued reports of cost growth in NASA’s major projects that puts taxpayer dollars at risk and could jeopardize future missions. I'm asking NASA for cost breakdown analyses to help understand and avoid continued deterioration of projects. https://t.co/iWvzdwozRd

Biologists agree that the Yellowstone population of grizzly bears has recovered and might have even reached capacity in many areas of the ecosystem. I am committed to working with the Administration to delist these bears and give Wyoming proper authority to manage its wildlife.

It is extremely disappointing that grizzly bears in the Yellowstone region will be added back to the endangered species list due to a frivolous lawsuit and a flawed court decision. https://t.co/InyWao0iI9

Happy National Day of the American Cowboy! Created by Wyoming U.S. Senator Craig Thomas in 2005 this resolution celebrates the cowboy spirit. The cowboy icon embodies integrity and courage while transcending ethnicity and gender. https://t.co/s09YUvNMx5
I’m glad the Taxpayers Right-to-Know Act passed unanimously today in HSGAC. Taxpayers in Wyoming deserve to know how their money is being spent. https://t.co/ddCeUBgRFv

It was an exciting weekend – as it always is during Cheyenne Frontier Days! @CheFrontierDays is an incredible time to come together and celebrate our cowboy spirit. https://t.co/rt8SOwnbAr

Closing an IRS office at any time creates problems for taxpayers in Wyoming. But it is particularly burdensome when it occurs during the filing season – and the first one after our comprehensive tax reform – when folks continue to learn how to comply with new tax changes.
